item.title: Interdisciplinarity and the Brickyard
item.description: div.figure { display: table; float: right; padding-left: 30px; padding-bottom: 10px; } div.figure p { display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; padding-left: 30px; } About twenty years ago, a mentor recommended B.K. Forscher’s 1963 essay Chaos in the Brickyard as I was thinking about what it meant to be a graduate student. Since then, I’ve probably read it another 15 times. Sure, the language is a bit dated, but I think the general concern that scientists (especially new scientists) have become overly focused on “bricks” and not “structures” is an important one - and one that seems more relevant today than it might have 60 years ago.
